content.description:
Walk up to the boulder, and the overhanging obvious face is your destination. 

  As soon as you come to the face, look 3-4 feet to the right of the first tree at the beginning of the overhang. You will find a nice low rail to match on for the sit start. 

  Sit start and make a tough pull up to the small crimps overhead. move up and climb directly into the block at the top to help with the top out.
content.location: As you walk up and around to the right of the Creekside Boulder at the overhanging face, match the rail 3-4 feet to the right of the close first tree at the start of the boulders steep face.

content.description:
Walk to the right side of the overhanging face and follow the lip down to the end where it becomes a slopey low lip to match on, just at the edge of the water. 

  Heel hook by your hands and start up the arete lip to the left. work into the awesome quartz stripe rails and negotiate to top out up and left.
content.location: Walk to the right side of the overhanging face and follow the lip down to the end where it becomes a slopey low lip to match on, just at the edge of the water.

content.description:
On the ride down from the top, you will cross over top of trestle  #44. Once over 44, you will ride over two smaller bridges. Very shortly after these two smaller bridges, watch for the wayside podium informing bikers about "Black Bears & Elk". Pass the sign and look to the left and you will see the Creek Side boulder next to the creek.  

  Pull off the trail a bit and get your creeper climb on!
